messageBody:
Thanks, Vladimir, I downloaded the files and I'll take a look at it.
About the static method with a boolean condition, it should probably
work, yes. I was wondering if there was no simpler way, a kind of
pattern already thought of doing it... but this will solve the
problem.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Vladimir R. Bossicard" <vladimir@b...>
wrote:
> > Does anyone know what could I possibly do? Maybe another approach?
>
> Maybe something like:
>
> class AllTests {
>
> private static RMIServer server = null;
>
> public static getRMIServer() {
> if (server == null) {
> // initialize
> }
> return server;
> }
> }
>
> and in the tests, you invoke AllTestrs.getRMIServer().
>
> I've not tested the code but it should work.
>
> If you're not afraid to work with beta code, there's the JUnit-
addons
> Runner (sf.net/projects/junit-addons). You can define resources to
be
> initialized before the tests are executed (like a RMI connection).
The
> code in cvs features an example with an RMI server.
>
> -Vladimir
>
> --
> Vladimir R. Bossicard
